Author: mechanical_fish
Content:
Let me guess: most failed startups are also run by 20 and 30 year olds.

I intend to wait until I'm 87 to start my company. We all know of failed startups that were founded by 20, 30, or 40-somethings, but you almost never see a failed startup with an 80-year-old founder. I'm sure that means something.

Author: reitzensteinm
Content: I've been recently relistening to the best interviews and talks from the last few years that I remember, and this one really stuck out (both in memory, and when I listened to it again).

Author: reitzensteinm
Content: Tim O'Reilly says that himself - he basically built his business around bad documentation. That reminds me, his Alpha Geek talk is exceptionally good.

Author: wammin
Content:
Haha, I have actually met Sam several times, slept on the floor of his apartment once or twice, almost crashed his Segway, took his money playing poker, and got drunk with him, so I can vouch for his existence. At one point he actually wrote one or two lines of code for Wamily, but was always on YC news all the time we had to let him go.

(kidding about that last part)

Author: npk
Content: I've read in a number of places that facebook is profitable.  Siince their ad revenue is so low, you've go to imagine flyers + gifts are making up for the difference.  Seeing that they've hired so many engineers, you've got to reckon they're racking in tons of $$$.
